etymology.description: 茯(fú, 艹 + 伏 phonetic) + 苓(líng, 艹 + 令 phonetic) = name of a medicinal fungus (Poria cocos).
etymology.interpretation: Names the poria sclerotium used in traditional medicine, marked with the herb radical even though it is a fungus. The phonetics 伏 and 令 supply the sounds fú and líng for this established binome.

parts.english: poria; tuckahoe; medicinal herb; (in compounds) poria part e.g., 茯神
poria; medicinal herb; used in plant/herb names; tuckahoe

examples.chinese: 中医常用茯苓利水渗湿，健脾安神(中醫常用茯苓利水滲濕，健脾安神)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngyī cháng yòng fúlíng lìshuǐ shènshī, jiànpí ānshén.
examples.english: In traditional Chinese medicine, poria is used to promote urination, drain dampness, strengthen the spleen, and calm the spirit.

examples.chinese: 我用茯苓煮粥，味道清淡(我用茯苓煮粥，味道清淡)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yòng fúlíng zhǔ zhōu, wèidào qīngdàn.
examples.english: I cook poria porridge; the flavor is mild.

examples.chinese: 药店有茯苓片和茯神等品种(藥店有茯苓片和茯神等品種)。
examples.pinyin: Yàodiàn yǒu fúlíng piàn hé fúshén děng pǐnzhǒng.
examples.english: The pharmacy carries poria slices and varieties like fushen.
